Color Palette

The MetLife colour palette has been designed to support the MetLife brand. The color scheme is cool and relaxed with lots of white space, enabling relatively detailed information on the website to be present in a clear, uncomplicated way.

Color Usage

Always allow white space for balancing the page and for ease of readability. Application of color shouold be well considered, compliment photos and aid the reader's understaning of visual data. Using PMS 285, and one additional color (as well as black) can create a comfortable visual rhythm while adding too many colors can create visual chaos, Using tints and shades (adding white or black) of the secondary palette is acceptable

Example Lorem

Ut quis neque sed massa convallis pharetra at et metus. Phasellus vehicula fringilla ipsum. Sed felis mi,sollicitudin et nisl at, convallis iaculis quam. Sed sit amet leo nibh.

METLIFE LOGO - BLUE

Logo Spacing

A minimum amount of white space must always surround the MetLife logo, separating it from other elements such as headlines, text, or imagery. The protected area is equal to the cap height of the MetLife "M" and is proportional to the size of the signature being used.

Sizing

Careful consideration should be given when determining the size of the MetLife logo. When it is too small it can be ineffective. The minimum size for the logo should be 1pica (4.25mm) for the height of the “M�? in MetLife.

Logo Usage

The MetLife name as expressed in the logo is the single most important visual component in establishing our brand presence. Our logo is clear, strong, timless presentation of our name.
